Package brickdestroy.levels

Class LevelScore

java.lang.Object
brickdestroy.levels.LevelScore
public class LevelScore
extends java.lang.Object
This class is responsible for accessing the permanent level high scores and displaying them when a level is completed or if player loses. It also shows the player's score with the permanent high scores.

  • Method Details

    • popUpLevelScore

      public void popUpLevelScore() throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      This method is responsible in getting the permanent level scores from files and displaying them onto the JOptionPane.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - In case the files cannot be found.

    • getLevelScoreFromFile

      private void getLevelScoreFromFile​(java.lang.String filePath, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> lvlScoresFromFile) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      This method is responsible for getting the level scores from the file and saving them into an array list.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The file path of the level scores in form of a string.
      lvlScoresFromFile - The array list in which the level's scores will be saved.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - In case the files cannot be found.

    • createScoreMessagePopUp

      public void createScoreMessagePopUp​(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> lvlScoresFromFile)
      This method is responsible for using a JOptionPane for displaying the user's level score and the permanent level score at the end of each round.
      Parameters:
      lvlScoresFromFile - The array list that contains the level's scores.

    • getLevelScore

      public int getLevelScore()
      This method is responsible in accessing the current level score from gameplay object.
      Returns:
      Returns the level score of ongoing game.
